Frequently Asked Questions

How is my trust score calculated?

Your trust score is based on 11 factors including social media verification (20%), community network (20%), platform activity (15%), content quality (15%), and more. It's designed to reflect your authenticity and community engagement.

What happens when content gets flagged?

Flagged content becomes temporarily invisible until a moderator reviews it. Both the flagger and content creator remain anonymous to each other, but moderators can see all identities. False flagging affects your trust score negatively.

How do I verify my social media accounts?

Go to your profile settings and connect your social media accounts. We verify the accounts are real and active, but we don't store passwords or post on your behalf. Verification is optional but helps build trust.

Why can I only review friends?

This ensures authentic feedback within trusted networks. You must be friends with someone before you can review them, which prevents spam and encourages genuine relationships.

What are the different account types?

Free accounts have basic features, Pro accounts get advanced analytics and priority support, and Venue accounts are for businesses hosting events with special event management tools.

Still need help?

Can't find what you're looking for? Our support team is here to help.
